references.paper_title: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
references.reason: This paper introduces InstructGPT, a pivotal model trained using reinforcement learning from human feedback, establishing a foundation for aligning language models with human intentions and shaping subsequent research in instruction tuning.

references.paper_title: LIMA: Less is more for alignment
references.reason: LIMA emphasizes the importance of data quality over quantity in instruction tuning, demonstrating strong performance with a smaller, meticulously curated dataset and influencing the focus on dataset quality within the field.

references.paper_title: Vicuna: An open-source chatbot impressing GPT-4 with 90%* ChatGPT quality
references.reason: Vicuna, an open-source chatbot, demonstrates competitive performance with ChatGPT through instruction tuning and significantly lowers the barrier to entry for research in this domain, promoting wider accessibility to high-performing language models.

references.paper_title: Self-Instruct: Aligning language models with self-generated instructions
references.reason: Self-Instruct introduces a method to bootstrap instruction data from LLMs themselves using a small seed set of instructions, showcasing an effective approach for data augmentation in instruction tuning and further inspiring the development of automated data generation techniques.

references.paper_title: WizardLM: Empowering large pre-trained language models to follow complex instructions
references.reason: WizardLM introduces Evol-Instruct, a novel method employing LLMs to evolve and refine existing instructions to enhance complexity and diversity, significantly contributing to advancements in generating high-quality instruction data.
